definition: to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: A fire burns in the cauldron, as a reminder of the Olympic flame.
sentences.chinese: 火炬塔裏燃燒着一團火焰，讓人想到奧林匹克聖火。

sentences.english: If the teacher is a lamp, I'm reluctant to burning wick.
sentences.chinese: 如果老師是一盞燈，我就是捨不得燃燒的燈芯。

sentences.english: The effect of atomizing is better and burning is more full by improving nozzle structure inside and outside.
sentences.chinese: 同時改進燒嘴結構，使霧化效果更好，燃燒更加完全。

sentences.english: Cigarettes,camp-fires and barbecues can all start a fire in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 香菸，營火和燒烤全部能開始一燃燒在那些農村內。

sentences.english: Three visualisations of nuclear combustion in a supernova.
sentences.chinese: 超新星內核燃燒的三種清晰呈像。

sentences.english: Clothing saturated with oxygen is readily ignitable and will burn vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 吸飽了氧的衣物很容易點燃，而且燃燒劇烈。

sentences.english: Could use bore scope for visual inspection of valves, chambers, cylinder.
sentences.chinese: 可以使用氣缸內窺儀檢查氣門，氣缸，燃燒室。

sentences.english: Thermite effects changed to look like it is burning for several seconds before causing damage.
sentences.chinese: 鋁熱效應改變的樣子是前幾秒鐘燃燒造成的損害。

sentences.english: The smouldering wreck fumed thick black smoke.
sentences.chinese: 燃燒的殘骸冒出濃烈的黑煙。

sentences.english: This article introduces a gun type of gas burners for radiating tube and a method of designing combustion unit for radiating tube.
sentences.chinese: 介紹一種槍式輻射管燃氣燃燒器及其燃燒頭的設計。

sentences.english: This article introduces a gun type of gas burners for radiating tube and a method of designing combustion unit for radiating tube.
sentences.chinese: 介紹一種槍式輻射管燃氣燃燒器及其燃燒頭的設計。

sentences.english: The particle size distributions of submicrometer particles during pulverized coal combustion were typically bimodal.
sentences.chinese: 煤粉燃燒細粒子的粒徑分佈呈典型的雙峯分佈。

sentences.english: She still thinks he was the culprit of torching his Long Island mansion.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然認爲50分是燃燒他的長島大廈的罪魁禍首。

sentences.english: R15 Contact with water liberates extremely flammable gases.
sentences.chinese: 遇水釋放極易燃燒的氣體。

sentences.english: Theory of water-blend heavy oil and combustion mechanism were discussed.
sentences.chinese: 對重油摻水乳化的實質及乳化油燃燒過程進行了探討。

sentences.english: Biomass may also include biodegradable wastes that can be burnt as fuel.
sentences.chinese: 生物量還包括能夠當作燃料燃燒的可降解廢料。

definition: to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
within the body/in vivo (vs in vitro)/internal to
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
